result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Bond to apply, 60 dtp balance.   Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Griffin

records.addlTxt:
11:07 AM Defendant Matthew J Griffin in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Sara Rogan.
Upon pl to sole count w/o repeater, the State recommends a fine. State modifies recommendation in 15CF1225 to a fine and will dismiss and read in 21CF1136. The Court conducts plea colloquy with the deft.
P-G
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Parties agree to waive a PSI in 20CF128 and rely upon prior PSI.

BTC: Guilty as above. 21CF1136 is DRI. 15CF1225 -  1 day RCJ =  1 day CFTS, costs, DNA sample & costs. Any balance 60 days to pay. FTP - 1 consecutive day for every $50.00 owed. FAW/vote
             20CF128 - RCJ=CFTS, $100 + cc, DNA sample & costs. Any balance 60 dtp. FTP - 1 consecutive day RCJ for every $50.00 owed. FAW/vote

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol. No RCAP monitoring is ordered.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Sentencing hearing on September 10, 2021 at 10:45 am.

09:15 AM Defendant Matthew J Griffin in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Defendant Matthew J Griffin in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Sara Rogan.
SEH to be set

BTC: Bond to be set at $200.00 cash. No alc/no RCAP monitoring  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2021 at 10:45 am.
Return on warrant on July 19, 2021 at 08:30 am.

P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1. Order PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Matthew J Griffin in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Withdrawing the motion. Request this matter be set for a change of plea.
BTC: Defendant to post an additional $200 by December 29th @ 5pm or Report to Racine County Jail. Must report to ZCI after court to test.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Matthew J Griffin in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request a motion date.
BTC: Adj  Motion hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew J Griffin in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Matthew J Griffin in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond previously set shall remain.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.
